relationships.description: Trump's polling performance in the 2016 US presidential election is identified as a major driver of MXN exchange rate movements
Analysts monitoring Bank of Mexico policy decisions and their impact on MXN

analysis.purpose: To provide empirical analysis of Donald Trump's effects on the Mexican peso and investment recommendations
analysis.significance: Shows how political events (US elections) directly impact currency markets and investment strategies

notable_quotes: Our analysis suggests the exchange rate is perhaps as much as 15% undervalued
Trump's chances in the US election have been a major driver of the Mexican peso
We recommend staying neutral the Mexican peso for now given US election risks are likely to remain high
red_flags: High volatility risk due to political uncertainty

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found; document is purely financial analysis

illegal_activity.description: Document contains legitimate financial research and analysis with no illegal activity

public_knowledge.context: Financial market analysis of political impacts on currency markets is standard practice and frequently covered by financial media

analysis.summary: This BofA Merrill Lynch research report analyzes the impact of Donald Trump's 2016 presidential campaign on the Mexican peso, finding the currency may be 15% undervalued due to election uncertainty, while recommending a neutral stance until election risks subside.
